testsuite.name: FlashcardsTest

testcase.name: start

failure.message:
java.lang.AssertionError: Wrong answer in test #7
Your line `Wrong answer. The correct one is "Paris", you've just written the definition of "Great Britain".` should NOT contain `you've just written the definition of`. The asked card was `France`, the answer was `London`.
Your output with test input (`>` indicates test input): Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): > import File name: > capitalsNew.txt 1 cards have been loaded Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): > add The card: > France The definition of the card: > Paris The pair ("France":"Paris") has been added. Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): > add The card: > Russia The definition of the card: > Moscow The pair ("Russia":"Moscow") has been added. Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): > remove The card: > Great Britain The card has been removed. Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): > export File name: > capitalsNew.txt 2 cards have been saved. Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): > import File name: > capitalsNew.txt 2 cards have been loaded Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): > ask How many times? > 4 Print the definition of "France": > London Wrong answer. The correct one is "Paris", you've just written the definition of "Great Britain".
Below you can see the output of your program during this test Notice, that '>' symbol means the start of the input:
Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): >import File name: >capitalsNew.txt 1 cards have been loaded Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): >add The card: >France The definition of the card: >Paris The pair ("France":"Paris") has been added. Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): >add The card: >Russia The definition of the card: >Moscow The pair ("Russia":"Moscow") has been added. Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): >remove The card: >Great Britain The card has been removed. Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): >export File name: >capitalsNew.txt 2 cards have been saved. Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): >import File name: >capitalsNew.txt 2 cards have been loaded Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): >ask How many times? >4 Print the definition of "France": >London Wrong answer. The correct one is "Paris", you've just written the definition of "Great Britain". Print the definition of "Russia": >Paris Wrong answer. The correct one is "Moscow", you've just written the definition of "France". Print the definition of "France": >Moscow Wrong answer. The correct one is "Paris", you've just written the definition of "Russia". Print the definition of "Russia": >Paris Wrong answer. The correct one is "Moscow", you've just written the definition of "France". Input the action (add, remove, import, export, ask, exit): >exit Bye bye!
